title: How to Convert JSON to CSV: The Complete Guide
description: Learn the fastest ways to convert JSON data to CSV format. Free online tool, API access, and step-by-step instructions.

sections.heading: Why Convert JSON to CSV?
sections.content:
JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is the standard format for APIs and web applications. But when you need to analyze data in Excel, Google Sheets, or import into a database, CSV is often the required format.

Common use cases include exporting API data for spreadsheet analysis, preparing data for database imports, sharing data with non-technical team members, and creating reports from JSON-based systems.

sections.heading: Handling Nested JSON Objects
sections.content:
One challenge with JSON to CSV conversion is handling nested objects. For example, if your JSON has nested address fields like {street, city, state}, ConvertFlow automatically flattens these into separate CSV columns like address.street, address.city, and address.state.

This ensures no data is lost during conversion while maintaining a flat structure that spreadsheets can understand.

sections.heading: JSON to CSV: Quick Reference
sections.content:
JSON arrays of objects convert cleanly to CSV where each object becomes a row and each key becomes a column header.

Arrays of arrays need special handling — the first array typically becomes headers.

Nested objects get flattened with dot notation (parent.child).

Arrays within objects are joined with semicolons by default.

Null values become empty CSV cells.
